definitions.definition: a thick piece of wood that is cut from or has fallen from a tree

examples.text: The road was blocked by fallen logs.
They haul the logs into the sawmill.

definitions.definition: an official record of events during a particular period of time, especially a journey on a ship or plane

examples.text: They keep a log of any accidents that occur at work.
She kept a log of their voyage.
A senior officer made a note in the ship's log.
The captain's log stopped abruptly in May 1944.

definitions.definition: a written or digital record of activity on a computer or phone line

examples.text: I checked the server's error logs.
The lawyers will review phone logs and other records.

definitions.definition: a logarithm (= any of a series of numbers set out in lists that make it possible to work out problems by adding and subtracting instead of multiplying and dividing)

examples.text: The whole procedure is as easy as ABC.
Fooling him was as easy as falling off a log.
He was so tired after all his exertions, he slept like a baby.
I usually sleep like a log.

wordOrigin: noun senses 1 to 2 Middle English (in the sense ‘bulky mass of wood’): of unknown origin; perhaps symbolic of the notion of heaviness.
